User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the MoneyPree application.

createdAt.description: Date and time when the user account was created.

FinancialGoal.title: FinancialGoal
FinancialGoal.description: Represents a financial goal set by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the financial goal.

userId.description: Reference to the User who set this goal. (Relationship: User 1:N FinancialGoal)

name.description: Name of the financial goal (e.g., 'Retirement', 'Down Payment').

currentAmount.description: Current amount saved towards the goal.

targetDate.description: Target date for achieving the goal.

strategy.description: The strategy the user is using to achieve the goal.

userId.description: Reference to the User who owns this budget. (Relationship: User 1:N Budget)

name.description: Name of the budget (e.g., 'Monthly Budget', 'Vacation Budget').

Expense.title: Expense
Expense.description: Represents an expense within a budget.

budgetId.description: Reference to the Budget this expense belongs to. (Relationship: Budget 1:N Expense)

Investment.title: Investment
Investment.description: Represents an investment made by a user.

userId.description: Reference to the User who made this investment. (Relationship: User 1:N Investment)

name.description: Name of the investment (e.g., 'Apple Stock', 'Vanguard S&P 500 ETF').

ChatMessage.title: ChatMessage
ChatMessage.description: Represents a chat message within the Expert Q&A feature.

id.description: Unique identifier for the chat message.

userId.description: Reference to the User who sent this message. (Relationship: User 1:N ChatMessage)

timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the message was sent.

isUserGenerated.description: Indicates whether the message was generated by the user or the AI.

userId.description: Reference to the User who owns this business.

industry.description: The industry the business operates in.

entityType.description: The legal entity type of the business.

BusinessTransaction.title: BusinessTransaction
BusinessTransaction.description: Represents a single financial transaction for a business.

businessId.description: Reference to the Business this transaction belongs to.

category.description: The accounting category for the transaction (e.g., 'Office Supplies', 'Software', 'Revenue').

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to ensure Authorization Independence, support QAPs (Queries are not Filters), and maintain data clarity.  User-owned data is organized under `/users/{userId}`, ensuring clear ownership and simplifies security rules.  The Membership Map pattern is not applicable here as there are no collaborative entities described.

*   **Users:** User profiles are stored under `/users/{userId}`. This allows for easy management of user data and simplifies security rules based on user ID.
*   **FinancialGoals, Budgets, Investments, ChatMessages:** These are all subcollections under `/users/{userId}`. This reflects the 1:N relationship between users and their goals, budgets, investments, and chat messages. This design ensures that only the user has access to their own data. The `userId` is implicitly denormalized because it's part of the path.
*   **Business Data:** A new subcollection `businesses` is added under `/users/{userId}` to store business profiles. Business-specific data, like `transactions`, are then nested under each business, creating a clear and scalable hierarchy.
*   **Authorization Independence:** Achieved by using path-based ownership for user data. Security rules can directly check `request.auth.uid` against the `userId` path parameter, avoiding the need for `get()` calls.
*   **QAPs Support:**  Segregation of data by user ID allows for efficient and secure list operations. Security rules can allow listing only when `request.auth.uid == userId`, ensuring that users can only access their own data.
